div.l: Sauyng a chyld that was half yer͗e of age
In cradell hit lay hit was a ꝓpropur page
This wenche thicke ⁊and wel y growe was
Wᵗith camoys nose ⁊and eyen grey as glas
Wᵗith buttockes brode ⁊and brestes rounde ⁊and hye
But right feyr͗e was hur here I wol not lye
The ꝑperersoıı̄un of the town for sheo was feyr͗eThis line is marked with two parallel strokes in the left margin which may indicate an unexecuted ¶.
In ꝓpᵘurposꝓpropospᵘurpos was to make hur his eyr
Bothe of his catell ⁊and of his mesuage
And strange he made hit for hur maryage
His pᵘurpos was to be stowe hur hye
In to som worthi blod of auncetrye
For holy churche good mot be dispendet
On holy churche blode that is descendet
Ther fore he wolde his holy blod honoure
Thaugh he shulde holy churche deuoure
¶ Gret soken hath this myller out of doute
Wᵗith whete ⁊and malt of al the lond a boute
And namely ther was a gret colage ⁊and an huge
Men clepen the soleres halle of Cambrigge
There was hur whete ⁊and hur malt y grounde
And on a day hit happened iananin a stounde
Sek lay the maunciple on a maladye
Men wende wysseli that he shulde dye
For sothe the myller stale bothe mele ⁊and corn
An hundred tyme more than he dude bi forn
For ther bi fore he stale but curteysly
But now he was thef outragesly
For the whiche the wardeyne chidde ⁊and made fare
But there of sette the myller not a tare
He craked boste ⁊and swore hit was not so
Ther were then yonge scoleres two
